intro: Apocopis intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate apocopis, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Apocopis intermedius is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
